title: The euro has failed to even match the Deutsche mark and the franc - here's why
text:
It was going to challenge the dollar. It would become the reserve currency of choice. And it would make Europe the leading force in the global monetary system, increasing its influence and reach, and providing a counterweight to an overbearing and over-mighty United States.

When the euro was launched 20 years ago, there was a lot of hype about how it could knock the dollar off is throne. And yet, what happened? It turns out that instead of increasing Europe’s influence, it has actually reduced it.

A paper published this month by the leading monetary economists Carmen Reinhart and Kenneth Rogoff took a variety of measures of the role of different currencies, from central bank reserves to international...
description: It was going to challenge the dollar.
